titleStmt.title: Silas Gatewood et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG7165

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Bedford Trimble co Ky
Oct 6. 1865
To his Excellency Thos E. Bramlette
Governor of Commonwealth of Kentucky

Your petitioners citizens of Trimble Co. Kentucky would respectfully represent that William L. Johnson of Said county was fined at the Oct. term 1865 of the circuit court for Trimble co Kentucky the sum of Seventy five Dollars Dollars for misdemeanor and made application to your Excellency through petition for pardon, and your Excellency did respite said fine for Twelve months months Now we would respectfully ask, that as the Said Johnson is poor and nearly blind and has a family to support that you remit Said fine, and we will ever pray &C, & C,

Silas Gatewood
Thomas Jones
A J Bartlett
F, A, Adams
Thos Peak
James. M. Staten
Jas. B. Cook.
Jeremiah Whitaker
J H. Lane
W. J. Wright
F. E. Skidmore
M. D. L Milner
J. B. Pierce
J R Hancock
J, G, Blake
D, S, Lane
P W Mullikin

Trimble Cir Ct
vs
Wm L. Johnson
$75.
Misdemeanor
Remitted 9 Dec /65
Fee paid
